content.description:
Sit or lay down start with the arete for the right hand and a crimp or side pull for the left. Pull on using some foot trickery and bump the right hand up the arete before moving to other holds with the left. Once established make a hard top out or move left to a small crimp knob and slopers. 

  Named after the heinous top out of the first ascent which left Jake with dirt all over his face.
content.location: This climb is located up the hill from Lone Wolf about 25 yards and slightly left.

content.description:
Lay-down start underneath the square-cut overhanging prow. Find the terrible right-hand divot starting hold and few options for feet. Find the compression necessary to pull on and then fire for a sloper out left. Latch this move then smack into a good meathook and figure out how to get on top.

Note: The detached and adjacent boulders are NOT used for this problem.
content.location: This boulder problem is found just up the hill from Lone Wolf and the Elemental Boulder. There is a 15-foot long face and this prow is found just left of this long face.

content.description: Sit or lay start with a good right hand and a decent crimp for the left. Using your choiceof footwork trickery, pull off and grab a diagnol arete-like feature. From here match or go big to a giant left hand sloper. Clamp down and reach up to other holds. get a foot on the sloper shelf and topout using a decent crimp knob.
content.protection: 1 pad and a spotter. Might tumble downhill without one.
content.location: Uphill from "The Lone Wolf" and left of "Faceful of Dirt". This is the center line of the boulder.

content.description:
This boulder is located fifty yards uphill from the "Lone Wolf Boulder". It features a short overhanging face that is about seven yards in length. Two lines have been done on the right side, and there is a possibility for a few more lines on the same face.

 On the opposite end of this face therefore is a steep overhanging prow known as the Blue Jean Block.

 Here is a short video which includes the first ascent of this challenging laser-cut overhanging monster!
